attributes.additional_details:
17 million voters ignored. In house bickering between Ministers and MPs and still not honouring the voter.
Calls for a second referendum making democracy worthless.
No mention of deals when the public had the vote to leave or stay in the E.U.
The public's lack of confidence in all MPs in Parliament is evident to all by their lack of understanding of what the people voted for, which was simply leave the E.U.
This has not been implemented.
attributes.background:
The public voted to leave the E.U. There was no mention of any deals or arrangements, just stay or leave.
The majority was to leave.
The in house bickering and deal making from Ministers and MPs has shown the house not fit to serve the public.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers, to be sacked.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 
Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
